## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm still trying to wrap my head around VerusIDs. What is the main purpose of VerusIDs in terms of identity and funds management?

**AI Assistant:**
VerusIDs aim to provide a system of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable. Does that make sense? It's a pretty powerful tool for managing your digital identity and assets.

**User:**
That does make sense. I've also heard of something called Verus Vault. What is that, and how does it protect identities and funds?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus Vault is a staking-capable time-locking and theft prevention feature that allows identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked. This ensures that even if a user's keys are compromised, the thief cannot spend the funds without unlocking the ID, which can be set to have a long delay. Additionally, users can choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID, making it virtually theft-proof. It's an extra layer of security to protect your assets.

**User:**
That sounds really useful. I've also heard that Verus allows users to create their own tokens or blockchains. Can you tell me more about that?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can interact with the Verus chain. These blockchains can be 50% POW/50% POS and 51% hash attack resistant, and can be merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. It's a really powerful feature that allows users to create their own custom blockchain solutions. Does that make sense? Do you have any more questions about Verus or VerusIDs?
What is the main purpose of VerusIDs in terms of identity and funds management?
VerusIDs aim to provide a system of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable.

tion of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable.
### Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault)
- Enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, typically long enough to notice when someone who might have compromised a user’s keys would have to unlock the ID before spending. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID. Users may also choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID as well. This enables virtually theft proof workflow and a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5$ wrench attack, and identity theft. IDs may be used as friendly name cryptocurrency addresses for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network. The VerusID protocol is a protocol, which can also be implemented on non-Verus systems.
### Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
- Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
### Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset

What capabilities does Verus provide for users who want to create their own tokens or blockchains?

Verus allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can interact with the Verus chain. These blockchains can be 50% POW/50% POS and 51% hash attack resistant, and can be merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
